userData.name: Gabriel Stawny
userData.interests: Listening to music, Traveling, Playing video games and Watching Live Coding

metadata.description: Hi, I'm a programmer with experience in several languages, strong analytical skills, ease of adapting to new challenges, and a focus on contributing to innovative projects. Here you can find more information about my projects and the technologies I use. Maybe we'll run into each other at a street race someday.

topics.title: Area of Expertise
topics.description: Development of web systems to support agricultural trials and evaluations.

topics.title: Technologies - Front-end
topics.description: Front-end development with Svelte, including building and maintaining flows, data screens, and advanced integrations with Highcharts.

topics.title: Technologies - Back-end
topics.description: Back-end development with Laravel, implementing business rules and REST/JSON integrations.

topics.title: Database
topics.description: MySQL database, including creation of SQL queries, filters, and pagination.

topics.title: Query Optimization
topics.description: Query optimization and manipulation of complex data, including tree-based structures for organization, processing, and performance.

topics.title: Report Generation
topics.description: Exporting complete reports in multiple formats (PDF, Excel, Word, and slides), using templates or fully dynamic generation.

topics.title: Extension Projects
topics.description: I worked on extension projects focused on real-world demands. Among them, I led the development of a software used by UTFPR professors to evaluate undergraduate research projects during the university congress. More than 1,000 students were evaluated using this tool.

topics.title: Algorithms Teaching Assistant
topics.description: I contributed to the university by helping peers understand complex computer science concepts and improve analytical skills. This experience also facilitated connections with leading professors.

shockwave.shortDescription: Full stack project developed with Spring Boot and Next.js, carried out in partnership with the Paran√° Military Police, focusing on the analysis and evaluation of the real impact of explosives.

syncgym.shortDescription: API developed with Spring Boot, following Clean Architecture principles, using as a case study a backend for a gym workout management application.
